content.description: Below is an attempt to derive the derivative of <math alttext="the cosecant of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>csc</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> using the product rule, where <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is in the domain of <math alttext="the cosecant of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>csc</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. In which step, if any, does an error first appear?
content.question: Step 1: <math alttext="the cosecant of x, times the sine of x, equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>csc</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>⋅</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>Step 2: <math alttext="the derivative, with respect to x, of, open parenthesis, the cosecant of x, times the sine of x, close parenthesis, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>csc</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>⋅</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>Step 3: <math alttext="the derivative, with respect to x, of, open parenthesis, the cosecant of x, close parenthesis, times, the sine of x, plus the cosecant of x, times the cosine of x, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>csc</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>csc</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>⋅</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>Step 4: <math alttext="the derivative, with respect to x, of the cosecant of x, equals, the fraction with numerator, the negative of cosecant of x, times the cosine of x, and denominator the sine of x, which equals, the negative of cosecant of x, times the cotangent of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>csc</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>csc</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>csc</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>⋅</mo></mrow><mi>cot</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.10: Finding the Derivatives of Tangent, Cotangent, Secant, and/or Cosecant Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
